intro: Dasistoma patula, commonly known as the narrow-leaf dasistoma, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, greenish-white flowers that are typically arranged in dense inflorescences. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grassland habitats. Due to its ornamental value and drought tolerance, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
